00072 proc usage {} {
00073

00075   puts ""
00076   puts "Options:"
00077   puts "  -h     Displays usage information"
00078   puts "  -v     Displays version"
00079   puts "  -nosb  Avoids populating the sidebar with the current"
00080   puts "           directory contents (only valid if no files are"
00081   puts "           specified)."
00082   puts "  -e     Exits the application when the last tab is closed"
00083   puts "           (overrides preference setting)"
00084   puts "  -m     Creates a minimal editing environment (overrides"
00085   puts "           preference settings)"
00086   puts "  -n     Opens a new window without attempting to merge"
00087   puts "           with an existing window"
00088   puts ""
00089   
00090   exit

00094 ######################################################################
00095 # Displays version information to standard output and exits.
00096 proc version {} {
00097 
00098   if {$::version_point == 0} {
00099     puts "$::version_major.$::version_minor ($::version_hgid)"
00100   } else {
00101     puts "$::version_major.$::version_minor.$::version_point ($::version_hgid)"
00102   }
00103   
00104   exit
00105   
00106 }

00108 ######################################################################
00109 # Parse the command-line options
00110 proc parse_cmdline {argc argv} {
00111 
00112   set ::cl_files         [list]
00113   set ::cl_sidebar       1
00114   set ::cl_exit_on_close 0
00115   set ::cl_minimal       0
00116   set ::cl_new_win       0
00117   
00118   set i 0
00119   while {$i < $argc} {
00120     switch -- [lindex $argv $i] {
00121       -h    { usage }
00122       -v    { version }
00123       -nosb { set ::cl_sidebar 0 }
00124       -e    { set ::cl_exit_on_close 1 }
00125       -m    { set ::cl_minimal 1 }
00126       -n    { set ::cl_new_win 1 }
00127       default {
00128         if {[lindex $argv $i] ne ""} {
00129           lappend ::cl_files [file normalize [lindex $argv $i]]
00130         }
00131       }
00132     }
00133     incr i
00134   }
00135   
00136 }
